## Background

This showcase is intended to illustrate different analysis possibilities of {{< fa brands tiktok >}} TikTok data downloaded with the [`Zeeschuimer`](https://github.com/digitalmethodsinitiative/zeeschuimer) browser extension.


## Data analysis

-   TikToks that are tagged with the hashtag `statistics`

-   collected via [`Zeeschuimer`](https://github.com/digitalmethodsinitiative/zeeschuimer) with .csv export via ğŸˆğŸˆ [**4CAT**](https://github.com/digitalmethodsinitiative/4cat)  ğŸˆğŸˆ

### Data import from {{< fa brands github >}}
```{r}
#| echo: false
pacman::p_load(digest)
v_digest <- Vectorize(digest::digest)
```

```{r}
# load packages
library(here)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)

statistics <- read_csv(
  here("content/07-webscraping-tiktok/data.local/tiktok-search-statistics.csv"), 
  col_types = cols(author_followers = col_number()))

# Anonymization of potentially sensitive information
statistics_hash <- statistics %>% 
  mutate(
     across(c(
       id:body,
       video_url:thumbnail_url), 
       ~ v_digest(.)))

# quick preview
statistics_hash %>% glimpse()
```

#### Periode in which the TikToks were posted

```{r}
#| fig-width: 16
#| fig-height: 9

# Load packages
library(lubridate)
library(sjPlot)
library(ggpubr)

# Display 
statistics %>% 
  mutate(date  = as.factor(year(timestamp))) %>% 
  plot_frq(date) +
  theme_pubr()
```

#### Location parameters of different statistics

```{r}
library(sjmisc)

statistics %>% 
  select(likes:plays) %>% 
  descr()
```

#### Distribution of likes

```{r}
statistics %>% 
  plot_frq(likes, type = "density")
```

#### Warning messages displayed

```{r}
statistics %>% 
  frq(warning)
```

### Text analysis

#### Corpus creation

```{r}
# Load packages
library(quanteda)

# Create corpus based on variable hashtags
crp <- corpus(
  statistics_hash, 
  docid_field = "id",
  text_field = "hashtags")

# Display
crp 
```

#### Tokenization

```{r}
# Create tokens based on corpus
tkn <- crp %>% 
  tokens(
    remove_punct = TRUE,
    remove_symbols = TRUE,
    remove_url = TRUE,
    remove_separators = TRUE)

# Display
tkn
```

#### Create Document-Feature-Matrix (DFM)

```{r}
# Create dfm based on tokens
dfm <- tkn %>% 
  dfm()

# Display
dfm
```

#### Wordcloud

```{r}
library(quanteda.textplots)

dfm %>% 
  textplot_wordcloud(
    min_size = 1,
    max_size = 8,
    max_words = 50,
    rotation = 0
  )
```

##### without the searchterm `statistics`

```{r}
dfm %>% 
  dfm_remove(pattern = "statistics") %>% 
  textplot_wordcloud(
    min_size = 1,
    max_size = 8,
    max_words = 50,
    rotation = 0,
    color = "dodgerblue3"
  )
```
